title: Development Process of Web Course Learning Objects Based on IMS Learning Design

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary web development and educational technology comprehension
context.additional_context: Strengthening practical social studies education content development with learner-customized simulation environments for skill reinforcement

learning_goals: Use IMS LD specifications to structure ≥3 learning objects (e.g., videos, quizzes, discussion boards), create 5-stage learning flow designs (introduction-development-activity-assessment-feedback) for each, and complete a learning design that meets ≥4 out of 5 peer evaluation rubric criteria (clarity, creativity, practicality, interactivity, technical completeness) within a 6-month course.
Acquiring practical skills to develop web-based learning objects in simulation/VR environments

Collaboratively complete a project-based assessment task (e.g., vocational field simulation) provided by a vocational training institution in a 4-5 member team, and submit a result achieving ≥4 points per category (≥15 out of 20 total points) on the evaluation rubric (teamwork, creativity, completeness, etc., 5 items).
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
